name: Amboseli Serena Safari Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here a few nights on the first leg of our Safari. Rooms were clean and comfortable with full wrap around mozzie nets. Food was really good, lots of choice. They have a couple of PCs in reception that you can use, worth taking a couple of blank DVDs, CDs and you can back up your pictures just top free up room on the camera. They also had an evening BBQ meal which cost extra but was well worth it, inlcuded wine and Masai dance. As for the park itself, saw Lions, Lots of Elephants, Zebra, Gazelles, Hippos and lots more. The lodge is a great base in a great park.
reviews.title: Great Park, great base.

reviews.text: We stayed at Amboseli as part of our two week safari holiday iN East Africa. Two families , two rooms. We were completely floored by the beauty of the savannahs and as we left Masai Mara, we were wondering what kind of hotel we will find at Amboseli. We were completely blown away by the gorgeous and spacious Serena Lodge at Amboseli. Not just that, the aesthetics were amazing - a balanced mix of Masai culture and modern luxury. We just loved the huge rooms, extremely well-done bath and dressing areas - anyone who has done safari in open jeeps, can appreciate the luxury of lovely bath facilities.
reviews.title: It was luxury in the middle of jingle - we loved it !

reviews.text: The whole lodge has excellent view of the majestic Mt KIlimanjaro.
reviews.title: Exceptional for a Lodge

reviews.text: It did not end there - the lounge bar and the dining area were done in such beautiful scale that it completely impressed us.. All along the hotel, we found beautiful masaai murals, paintings - related to the jungle and its life. every wall had a different motif and done in subtle earth colours, the final effect was breathtakingly beautiful.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous... Simply wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amboseli was our last Kenyan stop on our sixteen day safari. It did not dissapoint. The hotel has good staff that were helpful and pleasant. The restuarant has good food and lots of choices. We especially liked the champagne breakfasts, a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was well appointed and the wall painting made for a pleasant ambience. We were able so see some game from our deck and especially enjoyed the vervet monkeys and birds below.
reviews.title: worth the long journey

reviews.text: There is a large pool to relax around after the sometimes dusty hours game viewing.
reviews.title: Our favorite safari lodge

reviews.text: We felt the game drives are more restricted than other parks because there was less roads with great distances between them. The animals were sometimes quite far away to view without binoculars.
reviews.title: Great hotel to come back to after a hard day safaring!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this the best place to see herds of elephants. Large herds crossed the roads in front of us on there way to and from the swamps. We especially enjoyed watching submerged up to their shoulders eating grasses in the ponds.
reviews.title: Tired accomodation

reviews.text: After Lake Nakuru & Masai Mara Amboselli was a let down ....Unfortunately Mt Killimanjaro decided not to unveil herself and game sightings were far & few ....But one can see an occasional elephant , Hyena from the hotel itself and during the game drive the Elephants were marvelous.....50 at one glance is a sight to remember and enjoy .... such large animals playing amongst themselves 20 feet away from us was just too good......this was the best part of Amboselli .........the Hotel is clean & comfortable but the food was regular and the staff were polite and functional but not friendly infact disinterested............... We drove from Nairobi but its advisable to Fly into Amboselli as the last 80 kms of the road is awful .... very dusty and bumpy ....everything gets rattled. Thanks god we had planned to fly back...the small airfcraft flight back was memorable and a perfect ending to our Safari.
reviews.title: Average Hotel.... Destination Amboselli not so great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Serena chain is the best in Kenya, hands down. I had high expectations for the Amboseli property after staying in Serena in Nairobi and Masai Mara. Upon arrival, they put us into a room with two beds and then had staffers come to put them together immediately. However, I find this very uncomfortable, so I spoke to the manager to see if anything could be done and Herman was extremely apologetic and had them bring a new mattress right away. He also comped us a few things during our stay which was completely unnecessary.
reviews.title: Good hotel with excellent location and an amazing administration and staff

reviews.text: After this, he continued to check-in on us. Service was paramount to Herman and it showed.
reviews.title: Elephant paradaise!

aka: Amboseli Serena Safari Hotel Amboseli National Park
description: Situated on the shadow of Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest Mountain; beside a copse of giant Acacia trees and gently flowing natural spring. In the clean, crisp air of an Amboseli dawn, the snowcapped peaks of Mount Kilimanjaro shimmering in the southern sky, you can sit atop a volcanic throne in the middle of the Masai plains and see the world.
